meanings.definition: A form of joint ownership of property among two or more people, typically within a family.
meanings.sent1: In our family, the coparcenaries of the ancestral land are shared equally among siblings.
meanings.sent2: The coparcenaries of the house were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The coparcenaries of the old barn caused some amusing disputes among cousins.
meanings.sent4: Their coparcenaries in the business made them partners in both work and life.
meanings.sent5: The coparcenaries of the ancient treasure chest were said to bring luck to all who owned a share.

meanings.definition: The state of being coheirs or coparceners.
meanings.sent1: The coparcenaries of the siblings meant they inherited the estate together.
meanings.sent2: Their coparcenaries were evident in the equal division of the family heirlooms.
meanings.sent3: The coparcenaries of the twins led to some amusing mix-ups in the will.
meanings.sent4: Their coparcenaries in the company made them a formidable team.
meanings.sent5: The coparcenaries of the best friends made them feel like siblings.
